page.title: 14MR BOUGHTON
page.content: Mr.Boughton has lived in Elham all his life,occasionally working as a gardenar to neighbours. In 1967 he was paid Â£8 a week.He is a member of the Parish Council and is the amateur archivist for the Parish. Mr.Pitt, the Vicar of Elham is also involved with the School of Ministry in Canterbury. He has a busy life as Parish Priest, visiting sick people and attending meetings. As Chairman of the Sir John Williams Trust and of the school govenors he is very involved with education. The Archbishop of Canterbury has appoined Mr.Pitt a Six Preacher of the Cathedral. During the five years he holds the post he is required to preach a sermon annually in the Cathedral and is also a member of the Cathedral Greater Chapter.
